WorkItem.Description: The mage hit rating calculation for Rawr v2.2.23 is being done incorrectly. The hit rating and displayed value are correct (142 is 8.41% without heroic presence or misery/improved faerie fire), but the spec calculations are not correct. Fire, Arcane, and frost all have 100% chance to hit on the mouseover and appear to have 100% chance to hit in optimizer results. The program is choosing Boots of the mourning widow (ilevel 245) as a better upgrade than Footpads of the Icy Floe (ilevel 245) over my currently equipped Sandals of the Silver Magus (ilevel 232). In previous calculations, the optimizer forced me to maintain the hit cap and would choose Footpads of the Icy Floe or another item with hit rating on it. Deselecting and reselecting the hit buffs changes the percentage displayed properly (misery or improved faerie fire adds 3%, heroic presence 1% while keeping the same hit rating number), but the mouseover and calculation figure remain the same at 100%. Closing and restarting the program does not solve the issue either.

Comments.Message: Why is this still being posted? Why are people not reading the existing issues about this? Why are people still reporting issues with their character calculations, without attaching the character file? Sigh.
Two Hints: 1) check your talents ;)  2) search for issues before posting new ones :)

I reposted this because the issues I searched for were solved by checking talents and buffs. My issue is not solved by checking talents and buffs. With my talents and full raid buffs, I need 184 hit rating to be capped. RAWR is displaying me as capped on the mouseover at both 182 hit rating and 142 hit rating. Sorry for not including my files, I thought my description was sufficient.
Found the issue. My target level was set at 81 giving my natural hit rating from talents enough to be hit capped. The calculation appears to be working properly.
